main event: A UFO sighting was reported on April 23, 1953, lasting approximately 25 minutes in Addison, New York, with the object described as a small white blinking light with a dim blue glow.
interesting points: The observer, a 29-year-old male forest ranger, reported a sighting of a small white object with a dim blue glow that initially was stationary but started moving slowly away at an estimated 2 miles distance before disappearing from view.
The observer had reported a previous sighting in 1942, approximately 10 miles west of Addison, of an object seen for only a few seconds.
The observer estimated the speed of the object to be at approximately 2 miles per hour and the distance from the object to be around 2 miles away.
Weather conditions at the time were described as 'normal.'
The document includes a hand-drawn sketch of the observed UFO, depicting an elongated, asymmetrical shape with a dotted line indicating its movement.
sighted object: small white blinking object with a dim blue glow
